Film Reviews

Review: The Imitation Game

Benedict Cumberbatch is outstanding in a biopic of Alan Turing, the genius who helped crack the Enigma code. Anna Sinclair reviews.

Review: Nightcrawler

Jake Gyllenhaal's LA crime journalist is one of the most disturbing characters in modern film. Alex Killeen reviews.

Review: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 1

The latest instalment of the Hunger Games series is the darkest yet... and has some disturbing parallels with the world today. Rosemary Collins reviews.

Review: Whoops!

Luke Birtwistle attends the premiere of Whoops!, York's home-made black comedy that aims to make serial murder a laughing matter.

Review: Horns

By James Bithell

Daniel Radcliffe's new supernatural thriller has Hannah Caton yelling at the screen.

Aesthetica Short Film Festival 2014: Round-up of Day 3

Rosemary Collins and Rhys Thompson report from the final day of the 2014 Aesthetica Short Film Festival... and it's time to announce the winners.

Aesthetica Short Film Festival 2014: Round-up of Day 2

Would you base your life on the flip of a coin? Are we going to bury ourselves in rubbish? And what happens when a filmmaker photographs the same woman every day for a year? Rosemary Collins and Alex Killeen go on a journey of discovery at York's Aesthetica Short Film Festival

Aesthetica Short Film Festival 2014: Round-up of Day 1

Braving the pelting rain, George Wood and Kate Barlow bring you the highlights of the first day of the Aesthetica Short Film Festival

Review: Interstellar

By James Bithell

Christopher Nolan takes us on a journey into deep space, Alex Killeen throws out his thoughts as to whether he managed to crack infinity.

Review: Dracula Untold

By James Bithell

This Dracula reboot lacks any real bite. Niall Whitehead reviews

Review: '71

By James Bithell

Set on the streets of Belfast, this is an atmospheric and immediate thrill ride. Thomas Shutt reviews

Review: Annabelle

By James Bithell

If you look past plot flaws and mediocre acting it is easy to be immersed in the cheap thrills and horror cliches. Issie Akerman reviews

Review: Gone Girl

By James Bithell

You may find yourself scratching your head over the film's unsatisfying ending more than you do over Fincher's attempts at social commentary. Ricky Jones reviews

Review: Magic in the Moonlight

By James Bithell

Woody Allen's under-developed latest fails to live up to his previous hit, Blue Jasmine. Thomas Shutt reviews

Review: Maps to the Stars

By James Bithell

Cronenberg's latest deranged drama tries to do too much. Kate Barlow reviews

Review: Pride

By James Bithell

This warm and endearing tale of oppressed campaigners is a British comedy gem. Thomas Shutt reviews

Review: Two Days, One Night

By James Bithell

An understated modern day classic. Ricky Jones reviews

Review: If I Stay

By James Bithell

This Fault In Our Stars wannabe has more memorable music than performances. Afreen Hussain reviews

Review: Sin City 2: A Dame to Kill For

By James Bithell

This hyper-violent noir sequel lacks the pizzazz of its predecessor. Thomas Shutt reviews

Review: The Inbetweeners 2

By James Bithell

Will, Simon, Neil and Jay are back but this sequel does not quite reach the brilliance of the original series. Alex Killeen reviews

Review: To Catch A Thief

By James Bithell

Re-released Hollywood glamour oozes from Hitchcock's classy thrill ride through the French Riviera. Ricky Jones reviews

Review: Guardians of the Galaxy

By James Bithell

This new edition to the Marvel franchise may well be this generation's Star Wars. Alex Killeen reviews

Review: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes

By James Bithell

The apes have risen, now they prosper in the franchise's second instalment. Ricky Jones reviews

Review: Begin Again

By James Bithell

Begin Again is a twist on the conventional rom-com. Katy Sandalls reviews.

Review: Boyhood

By James Bithell

Boyhood proves to be more than your classic coming of age story. Alex Killeen reviews.

Review: How to Train Your Dragon 2

Here be a film that's all about Toothless. Alfie Packham reviews.

Review: Mrs Brown's Boys D'Movie

By James Bithell

Mrs Brown fails to provide many laughs. Niall Whitehead reviews.

Review: 22 Jump Street

By James Bithell

Delivering more action, more gags and more homoeroticism makes this sequel as funny as the first. Kate Barlow reviews

Review: Concussion

By James Bithell

Adult in every sense of the word, this drama about a lesbian housewife turned escort asks what comes after equality. Rosemary Collins reviews

Review: The Fault In Our Stars

By James Bithell

Sentimental, unsurprising and convenient, this John Green adaptation doesn't divert from its vanilla expectations. Ida Sjoberg reviews
